intro: Macleania poortmannii, commonly known as the Poortmann's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of oak and hickory trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife species.
